iati-activity.title: Livelihood Empowerment Against Poverty
iati-activity.description: To accelerate progress towards secure, equitable and accountable access to social protection by providing financial and technical assistance to the Government of Ghana's national cash transfer programme. DFID's support will enable 100,000 of the poorest people, including 60,000 women and girls, to receive regular cash grants by 2016. This contributes to our MDGs by lifting the extremely poor and vulnerable people in Ghana out of poverty by helping them meet their basic needs.

iati-activity.title: Girls - Participatory Approaches to Students Success (PASS) in Ghana
iati-activity.description: To increase participation and the quality of secondary education by providing disadvantaged girls with secondary level scholarships and Colleges of Education with targeted support to improve teacher education and management. This will benefit 81,000 girls and 38 Colleges of Education and improve gender parity and quality of teaching and learning. This contributes towards our MDGs by improving better access and gender parity by 2015

iati-activity.title: Adolescent Reproductive Health in Ghana
iati-activity.description: To improve the knowledge and behaviour around reproductive health of adolescents in Ghana by providing reproductive health information to in and out of schools. This will benefit approximately 400,000 of the adolescent population, generating evidence that will allow scale up of cost-effective adolescent reproductive interventions. This contributes towards our MDGs by addressing the behaviour around reproductive health and will result in achieving MDG5 by 2016.

iati-activity.title: Ghana Health Sector Support Programme - 2012 - 2018
iati-activity.description: To improve the health system in Ghana, by providing the Ministry of Health with direct budget support, materials, goods and technical assistance. This support will improve coverage and quality of primary care services and create a sustainable health system. In addition to improving the health sector as a whole, estimates show that by 2015, our Sector Budget Support will contribute towards MDG 4 and 5 by saving 1,400 newborn lives, preventing 425 stillbirths and saving 450 maternal lives. We also estimate this to prevent approximately 2,000 child deaths.

iati-activity.title: Support for malaria control in Ghana
iati-activity.description: To reduce the number of Ghanaians being ill with or dying from malaria through better prevention and diagnosis and the improvement of Ghanas national malarial control strategy. Key results by 2016 include increasing the proportion of pregnant women sleeping under a bednet by 33% and reducing the number of malaria specific deaths amongst the general population from 2815 (2012) to 2252. This contributes to our MDGs by tackling malaria and maternal health.

iati-activity.title: DELIVER: Support to Office of the President Policy Delivery Unit and Cabinet Secretariat
iati-activity.description: To strengthen the capacity of the Policy Delivery Unit and the Cabinet Secretariat of Ghanas Presidency to enable them to implement and deliver their top development priorities through better tasking, supporting, challenging and monitoring of the relevant areas of government and the wider public sector. This will support the effective delivery of the Presidents development agenda and help ensure that public spending reflects agreed priorities. This programme will increase the accountability of ministers and allow the public to be more informed about government actions.

iati-activity.title: Supporting Anti- Corruption in Ghana
iati-activity.description: The purpose of this project is to improve Ghanas anti-corruption financial management. Improved public financial management will lead to improved service delivery, improved prospects for growth, stability, the general investment climate and reduce the risks of crime and money laundering by 2019.
